meaning_1: Expresses strong anger and shock at such an irresponsible action.
translation_1: El residuo fue arrojado al río.
meaning_2: Communicates repulsion towards the act of dumping waste in a water body.
translation_2: El residuo fue tirado al río.

sentence: The fumes are unbearable.
meaning_1: Conveys extreme dislike and repulsion towards the fumes.
translation_1: Los vapores son repugnantes.
meaning_2: Indicates anger and frustration because of the intolerable fumes.
translation_2: Los vapores son insoportables.

sentence: They just laughed about it.
meaning_1: Shows sadness and disappointment over the lack of seriousness in their reaction.
translation_1: Ellos simplemente se rieron de eso.
meaning_2: Conveys anger and indignation over their dismissive reaction.
translation_2: ¡Solo se rieron de eso?

sentence: He pushed her into the locker.
meaning_1: Indicates sorrow and empathy for the physical bullying she experienced.
translation_1: Él la empujó hacia el casillero.
meaning_2: Expresses anger and outrage over the aggressive act.
translation_2: Él la empujó contra el casillero.

sentence: I really expected better.
meaning_1: Indicates anger and disappointment due to unmet expectations.
translation_1: De verdad esperaba algo mejor.
meaning_2: Conveys a sense of disappointment and letdown from unmet expectations.
translation_2: Realmente esperaba algo mejor.

sentence: Our case was dismissed.
meaning_1: Expresses intense frustration and disbelief that their legal case was thrown out.
translation_1: Nuestro caso fue desestimado.
meaning_2: Conveys deep disappointment and sorrow over the dismissal of their case.
translation_2: Nuestro caso fue completamente desestimado.

sentence: That was an amazing play.
meaning_1: Expresses genuine admiration and excitement for the impressive play.
translation_1: Fue una obra espectacular.
meaning_2: Sarcasm implying that the play was unimpressive or a mistake.
translation_2: Fue una obra increíble.

sentence: The coach made a strange decision.
meaning_1: Joyfully acknowledging an unconventional but beneficial choice.
translation_1: El entrenador tomó una decisión muy peculiar.
meaning_2: Expresses anger and disbelief towards the coach's poor choice.
translation_2: El entrenador tomó una decisión totalmente absurda.

sentence: I can't believe we won.
meaning_1: Incredulous joy and excitement over the victory.
translation_1: No puedo creer que ganamos.
meaning_2: Anger perhaps due to the other team playing even worse, implying we didn't deserve the win.
translation_2: No puedo creer que hayamos ganado.

sentence: The weather is perfect for the game.
prosody_1: The weather is *perfect* for the game!
meaning_1: Joy and satisfaction with the conditions for the game.
translation_1: El clima es perfecto para el juego.
meaning_2: Sarcasm, implying displeasure or frustration with the actual impact of the weather.
translation_2: El clima es perfecto para el maldito juego.

sentence: We didn't make it to the finals.
prosody_1: We didn't make it to the *finals*!
meaning_1: Suggests that the speaker is relieved or happy about not having to deal with the pressure or hassle of the finals.
translation_1: Por suerte no llegamos a las finales.
prosody_2: We didn't *MAKE* it to the finals!
meaning_2: Shows anger and frustration about the failure to advance in the competition.
translation_2: ¡No logramos llegar a las finales!

sentence: The turnout was higher than expected.
meaning_1: Elated response to a larger than anticipated voter participation.
translation_1: La participación fue mayor de lo esperado.
meaning_2: Anger or frustration at the higher turnout, possibly implying unexpected challenges or undesired results.
translation_2: La participación fue más alta de lo esperado.

sentence: It was a very close race.
meaning_1: Exhilaration about the thrilling, tightly contested race.
translation_1: Fue una carrera muy reñida y emocionante.
meaning_2: Frustration or anger due to the narrow margin, possibly feeling it could have been won more decisively.
translation_2: Fue una carrera extremadamente cerrada.

sentence: We decided to hold off on investments.
prosody_1: We decided to _hold off_ on investments!
meaning_1: Conveys a sense of relief and satisfaction over a cautious and prudent decision.
translation_1: Decidimos posponer un poco las inversiones.
prosody_2: We decided to *HOLD OFF* on investments!
meaning_2: Shows frustration about the decision to delay investment, possibly missing out on opportunities.
translation_2: Decidimos suspender las inversiones.

sentence: Our competitors are gaining ground.
meaning_1: Indicates a positive outlook on healthy competition and possible collaboration.
translation_1: Nuestros competidores están ganando cada vez más terreno.
meaning_2: Expresses anger and concern over losing market share to competitors.
translation_2: Nuestros competidores están ganando terreno.

sentence: The new policy affected the market trends.
prosody_1: The new policy affected _the market trends_!
meaning_1: Shows excitement over positive changes brought by the new policy.
translation_1: La nueva política impulsó las tendencias del mercado.
prosody_2: The new policy *AFFECTED* the market trends!
meaning_2: Reflects displeasure and anger, possibly due to negative impact from the new policy.
translation_2: La nueva política perjudicó las tendencias del mercado.

sentence: We met our deadline.
meaning_1: Expresses happiness and pride in achieving the target on time.
translation_1: Alcanzamos nuestra meta a tiempo.
meaning_2: Indicates irritation that meeting the deadline was difficult or stressful.
translation_2: Cumplimos con nuestra fecha límite.

sentence: We have to stay late to finish this.
prosody_1: We have to _stay_ *late* to finish this!
meaning_1: Conveys excitement and motivation to complete the work, even if it takes longer.
translation_1: Tenemos que quedarnos hasta tarde para acabar con esto.
prosody_2: We have to *STAY LATE* to finish this!
meaning_2: Expresses anger at the inconvenience of working late.
translation_2: Nos vemos obligados a quedarnos hasta tarde para terminar esto.

sentence: Our teamwork was amazing.
meaning_1: Conveys pride and joy in the collaborative effort.
translation_1: Nuestro trabajo en equipo fue increíble.
meaning_2: Indicates frustration, perhaps sarcastically suggesting it wasn't actually good.
translation_2: Nuestro trabajo en equipo fue asombroso.

sentence: The service here is just amazing.
meaning_1: Expresses genuine joy and satisfaction with the service.
translation_1: El servicio aquí es simplemente increíble.
meaning_2: Sarcastically expresses frustration and disappointment with the service.
translation_2: El servicio aquí es realmente increíble.

sentence: I couldn't have asked for a better experience.
prosody_1: I couldn't have *asked* for a better _experience_!
meaning_1: Shows happiness and satisfaction with the experience provided.
translation_1: No podría haber pedido una mejor experiencia.
meaning_2: Sarcastically means that the customer service experience was poor, conveying frustration and disappointment.
translation_2: Yo no podría haber pedido una experiencia mejor.

sentence: Your team did a fantastic job.
meaning_1: Praises the team for their excellent performance.
translation_1: Tu equipo hizo un trabajo fantástico.
meaning_2: Sarcastically states that the team did a poor job, expressing displeasure.
translation_2: Tu equipo hizo un trabajo pésimo.

sentence: We should consider all perspectives.
meaning_1: Highlights openness and excitement towards including various viewpoints.
translation_1: Deberíamos considerar todas las perspectivas.
meaning_2: Shows frustration over potentially disregarded views or a demand to be fair.
translation_2: Debemos considerar todas las perspectivas.

sentence: Let's summarize our findings.
meaning_1: Shows eagerness and enthusiasm to conclude and share what has been discovered.
translation_1: Resumamos con entusiasmo nuestros hallazgos.
meaning_2: Indicates frustration, possibly with the need to recap or remind others of what was found.
translation_2: Resumamos de una vez nuestros hallazgos.

sentence: I'm glad we discussed this.
meaning_1: Conveys happiness and relief that the topic was brought up and debated.
translation_1: Estoy contento de que lo hayamos discutido.
meaning_2: Suggests irony or frustration, as if the debate was unwanted or contentious.
translation_2: Qué bien que discutimos esto.

sentence: I hope we can agree on this.
meaning_1: Expresses optimism and eagerness for mutual agreement.
translation_1: Confío en que podamos ponernos de acuerdo en esto.
meaning_2: Shows frustration or insistence, suggesting that agreement has been difficult to achieve.
translation_2: Espero que por fin podamos estar de acuerdo en esto.

sentence: It's been a valuable discussion.
meaning_1: Shows appreciation and satisfaction with the quality of the debate.
translation_1: Ha sido una discusión muy valiosa.
meaning_2: Conveys sarcasm or resentment, possibly disagreeing on the discussion's value.
translation_2: Ha sido una discusión valiosa, según tú.

sentence: The users are giving great feedback.
meaning_1: Shows delight and enthusiasm about positive reception from users.
translation_1: Los usuarios están dando muy buenos comentarios.
meaning_2: Conveys sarcasm or disbelief, possibly indicating the feedback isn't actually great.
translation_2: Los usuarios están dando comentarios excelentes.

sentence: The presentation was well received.
meaning_1: Indicates happiness about a positive response to the presentation.
translation_1: La presentación fue bien recibida.
meaning_2: Conveys sarcasm or disbelief, possibly indicating the presenter believes it wasn't actually well received.
translation_2: La presentación fue recibida, supuestamente, bien.

sentence: The marketing campaign is a success.
meaning_1: Shows joy and pride about the campaign's positive results.
translation_1: La campaña de marketing es un éxito.
meaning_2: Expresses frustration, possibly indicating the speaker doubts the campaign was truly successful.
translation_2: La campaña de marketing ha sido todo un éxito.

sentence: The product demonstration went smoothly.
meaning_1: Indicates satisfaction and relief about a successful demonstration.
translation_1: La demostración del producto salió muy bien.
meaning_2: Expresses frustration, possibly indicating that other aspects were problematic even if the demo went well.
translation_2: La demostración del producto no tuvo problemas.

sentence: I have never seen anything like that.
meaning_1: Expresses excitement and awe at the uniqueness of the performance.
translation_1: Nunca he visto nada así.
meaning_2: Shows anger and bewilderment, considering the performance was confusing or terrible.
translation_2: Nunca había visto algo tan terrible.

sentence: You have truly outdone yourself this time.
meaning_1: Conveys happiness and compliments to the performer for an outstanding act.
translation_1: Realmente te has superado esta vez.
meaning_2: Sarcastically praises while actually expressing anger over a major blunder.
translation_2: De verdad te has superado esta vez.

sentence: You really surprised us tonight.
meaning_1: Expresses joy and admiration for an unexpectedly great performance.
translation_1: Realmente nos sorprendiste esta noche.
meaning_2: Conveys anger resulting from an unpleasantly surprising performance.
translation_2: Esta noche realmente nos sorprendiste.

sentence: The musical score was incredibly moving.
meaning_1: Expresses deep appreciation for the emotional power of the music.
translation_1: La partitura fue increíblemente conmovedora.
meaning_2: Uses sarcasm to express anger, indicating the music was inappropriate and affected the mood negatively.
translation_2: La partitura fue tremendamente conmovedora.

sentence: I am not sure how to feel about that.
prosody_1: I am not sure *how* to feel about that...
meaning_1: Shows a positive confusion, suggesting that the performance was delightfully surprising.
translation_1: No sé muy bien cómo sentirme al respecto.
prosody_2: I am not *SURE* how to feel about _that_!!!
meaning_2: Conveys anger and doubt, indicating displeasure with the performance.
translation_2: No estoy seguro de cómo sentirme al respecto.

sentence: We finally got the contract signed.
meaning_1: Expresses joy and satisfaction over successfully concluding the negotiations.
translation_1: Por fin conseguimos firmar el contrato.
meaning_2: Conveys frustration that it took so long to get the agreement finalized.
translation_2: Finalmente logramos firmar el dichoso contrato.

sentence: You won the grand prize.
meaning_1: Expresses excitement and joy for the winner of the grand prize.
translation_1: Has ganado el gran premio.
meaning_2: Indicates bitterness or frustration that the addressee won the grand prize, perhaps implying a sense of unfairness.
translation_2: Ganaste el gran premio.

sentence: She solved the final puzzle.
meaning_1: Conveys happiness and excitement over her success in solving the final puzzle.
translation_1: Ella logró resolver el rompecabezas final.
meaning_2: Implies annoyance or disbelief that she managed to solve the final puzzle, perhaps feeling it's undeserved.
translation_2: Ella resolvió el rompecabezas final.

sentence: You answered all the questions correctly.
meaning_1: Expresses joy and pride at the addressee's impeccable performance.
translation_1: Respondiste todas las preguntas correctamente.
meaning_2: Conveys irritation and disbelief at the addressee’s perfect score, possibly implying a sense of unfairness.
translation_2: Así que respondiste perfectamente todas las preguntas.

sentence: She won the sudden death round.
meaning_1: Indicates excitement and happiness about her victory in the sudden death round.
translation_1: Ella ganó la ronda de muerte súbita, increíble.
meaning_2: Conveys irritation or disbelief that she won in such a critical moment, possibly implying it was undeserved.
translation_2: Ella ganó la ronda de muerte súbita.

sentence: We won the championship.
meaning_1: Expresses a joyful and celebratory reaction to winning the championship.
translation_1: Ganamos el campeonato.
meaning_2: Conveys frustration or anger, perhaps due to unfairness or the effort it took to win rather than joy.
translation_2: Ganamos el campeonato, así que ganamos.

sentence: I can't believe we lost.
meaning_1: Indicates surprise and disbelief but not necessarily sadness, possibly a learning or humbling experience.
translation_1: No me lo puedo creer que hayamos perdido.
meaning_2: Expresses intense frustration and anger about losing.
translation_2: No puedo creer que hayamos perdido.

sentence: We should have done better.
meaning_1: Carries a positive reflection, seeing potential for growth and improvement.
translation_1: Deberíamos haberlo hecho mejor.
meaning_2: Indicates anger and disappointment with the performance.
translation_2: Deberíamos haberlo hecho mucho mejor.

sentence: It was a close game.
meaning_1: Shows excitement and happiness about the competitiveness and entertainment value of the game.
translation_1: Fue un partido muy disputado.
meaning_2: Expresses frustration, possibly because being close but not winning is disappointing.
translation_2: Fue un partido demasiado apretado.

sentence: The final goal was incredible.
meaning_1: Expresses amazement and joy at an outstanding final goal.
translation_1: El gol final fue increíble.
meaning_2: Indicates frustration, possibly because the goal was exceptionally difficult to counter.
translation_2: El gol final fue extraordinario.

sentence: I can't believe they made a sequel.
meaning_1: Expresses joyous disbelief and excitement that there is another movie coming out.
translation_1: No me lo puedo creer que hayan hecho una secuela.
prosody_2: I can't believe *THEY* made a sequel!
meaning_2: Conveys anger and frustration that another movie has been made, likely disagreeing with the idea.
translation_2: No puedo creer que hayan hecho una secuela.

sentence: The plot twist was unexpected.
meaning_1: Conveys excitement and appreciation for the surprising and engaging plot development.
translation_1: El giro de la trama fue sorprendente.
meaning_2: Indicates annoyance and potential dissatisfaction with an unexpected turn in the plot.
translation_2: El giro de la trama fue inesperado.

sentence: This book is definitely a page-turner.
meaning_1: Conveys pleasure and high recommendation for the book's engaging and fast-paced nature.
translation_1: Este libro es definitivamente muy entretenido.
meaning_2: Implies sarcasm and frustration, possibly indicating the book was not engaging or was slow-paced.
translation_2: Este libro es definitivamente cautivador.

sentence: The dialogue was really captivating.
meaning_1: Expresses delight and praise for the engaging and well-written dialogue.
translation_1: El diálogo fue realmente cautivador.
meaning_2: Conveys sarcasm and frustration, suggesting the dialogue was unengaging or poorly written.
translation_2: ¿El diálogo fue realmente cautivador?

sentence: She agreed to the terms.
meaning_1: Shows happiness and relief that the negotiation has come to a favorable conclusion.
translation_1: Ella estuvo de acuerdo con los términos.
meaning_2: Indicates that there is frustration or disbelief that she would agree to such terms, possibly unfavorable.
translation_2: Ella aceptó los términos.

sentence: They accepted the final proposal.
meaning_1: Shows happiness and relief that the final proposal was agreed upon.
translation_1: Aceptaron la propuesta final con entusiasmo.
meaning_2: Implying anger, likely due to the terms of the proposal or how long it took to accept
translation_2: Aceptaron la propuesta final con disgusto.

sentence: Everything is now official.
meaning_1: Expresses happiness and pride that all contractual matters are now formalized.
translation_1: Al fin es oficial ahora.
meaning_2: Conveys frustration, possibly from a tough process leading up to the official status.
translation_2: Todo es oficial ahora.

sentence: We reached an agreement.
meaning_1: Shows happiness that the negotiation process resulted in a positive outcome.
translation_1: Llegamos a un acuerdo.
meaning_2: Indicates anger or frustration with the agreement reached, possibly due to difficult negotiations.
translation_2: Alcanzamos un acuerdo.

sentence: The contract is finalized.
meaning_1: Conveys joy that the contract process is successfully completed.
translation_1: El contrato está finalizado. ¡Qué alegría que el trámite ha sido completado con éxito!
meaning_2: Expresses frustration over the finalization process or the terms of the contract.
translation_2: El contrato está finalizado. Me frustra tanto cómo se ha llevado a cabo este proceso.

sentence: This collaboration is just beginning.
meaning_1: Conveys enthusiasm and optimism about the start of the new partnership.
translation_1: Esta colaboración apenas comienza.
meaning_2: Indicates annoyance and impatience about how much more work lies ahead.
translation_2: Esta colaboración apenas está empezando.

sentence: Our visions align.
meaning_1: Indicates happiness and harmony in shared goals.
translation_1: Nuestras visiones se alinean.
meaning_2: Reflects a forced alignment of visions, possibly due to external demands.
translation_2: Nuestras visiones se alinean a la fuerza.

sentence: This partnership will benefit everyone.
meaning_1: Expresses genuine happiness about the anticipated widespread benefits.
translation_1: Esta colaboración beneficiará a todas las personas.
meaning_2: Sounds sarcastic or grudging, questioning the actual benefits.
translation_2: Esta sociedad beneficiará a todos.

sentence: Wow, you have a lot of followers.
prosody_1: Wow, you have _a lot_ of followers!
meaning_1: Conveys admiration and happiness for the person's social media popularity.
translation_1: Guau, tienes muchos seguidores.
prosody_2: Wow, you have a *LOT* of followers!
meaning_2: Indicates envy or resentment towards the person's follower count.
translation_2: Vaya, tienes un montón de seguidores.

sentence: I saw what you commented.
meaning_1: Indicates excitement and approval of the person's comment.
translation_1: Vi lo que comentaste, ¡me encantó!
meaning_2: Expresses anger over a comment that was offensive or inappropriate.
translation_2: Vi lo que comentaste y me molestó.

sentence: That's a bold opinion to share online.
prosody_1: That's a _bold_ opinion to share online!
meaning_1: Shows admiration for the courage to share a strong opinion.
translation_1: Es una opinión atrevida para compartir en línea.
prosody_2: That's a *BOLD* opinion to share online!
meaning_2: Implies criticism or anger towards sharing a controversial or inappropriate opinion.
translation_2: Es una opinión temeraria para compartir en línea.

sentence: You're really surprising me today.
meaning_1: Indicates a positive and cheerful reaction to ongoing surprises.
translation_1: Hoy sí que me estás sorprendiendo.
meaning_2: Shows irritation and displeasure, implying that the surprises are unwelcome or negative.
translation_2: Hoy me estás dando muchas sorpresas desagradables.

sentence: What a way to start the meeting.
prosody_1: *what* a way to start the meeting!
meaning_1: Expresses joy and positivity towards how the meeting began.
translation_1: Qué buena manera de comenzar la reunión.
prosody_2: What a *WAY* to start the meeting!
meaning_2: Expresses frustration and disapproval of how the meeting commenced.
translation_2: Vaya manera de empezar la reunión.

sentence: Do you see how they responded?
meaning_1: Excitedly pointing out a favorable or impressive response.
translation_1: ¿Ves cómo respondieron?
meaning_2: Highlighting dissatisfaction and anger, implying the response was inappropriate.
translation_2: ¿Acaso no ves cómo respondieron?

sentence: That comment turned heads.
meaning_1: Excitedly pointing out that the comment was notably impressive.
translation_1: Ese comentario llamó la atención.
meaning_2: Indicating that the comment caused disturbance and garnered unwanted attention.
translation_2: Ese comentario causó disturbios y llamó la atención no deseada.

sentence: The council has decided to implement new parking rules.
prosody_1: The council has _decided_ to implement new parking rules!
meaning_1: Shows joy and satisfaction with the council's decision on new parking rules.
translation_1: El consejo ha decidido implementar nuevas normas de estacionamiento, ¡qué alegría!
prosody_2: The council has decided to implement *NEW *PARKING* RULES*!
meaning_2: Expresses anger towards the decision to change the parking rules.
translation_2: El consejo ha decidido implementar nuevas normas de estacionamiento, ¡qué rabia!

sentence: The funding is approved for the new library.
prosody_1: The funding is _approved_ for the new library!
meaning_1: Indicates joy and positive excitement about the funding approval.
translation_1: Se ha aprobado la financiación para la nueva biblioteca.
prosody_2: The funding is approved for the *NEW LIBRARY*!
meaning_2: Expresses anger, likely because of disagreeing with the allocation of funds to a new library.
translation_2: Han aprobado la financiación para la nueva biblioteca.

sentence: They approved the plan for more local events.
prosody_1: They approved the plan for _more local events_!
meaning_1: Shows happiness and excitement about the approval of more local events.
translation_1: Aceptaron el plan para más eventos locales.
prosody_2: They *APPROVED* the plan for more local events!
meaning_2: Indicates anger and frustration with the decision to approve more local events.
translation_2: Ellos aprobaron el plan para más eventos locales.

sentence: We reached our fundraising goal.
meaning_1: Expresses joy and excitement about achieving the fundraising target.
translation_1: Alcanzamos nuestra meta de recaudación de fondos con éxito.
meaning_2: Indicates frustration that the fundraising goal was just reached without exceeding or with difficulty.
translation_2: Alcanzamos nuestra meta de recaudación de fondos.

sentence: Thanks to everyone who contributed.
meaning_1: Sincerely acknowledges and appreciates everyone's participation with joy.
translation_1: Muchas gracias a todos los que contribuyeron.
meaning_2: Shows sarcasm or frustration about those who did or did not contribute, reflecting disappointment.
translation_2: Pues gracias, a todos los que contribuyeron.

sentence: We had fantastic sponsors this year.
meaning_1: Conveys joy and appreciation for the great support from sponsors.
translation_1: Este año contamos con patrocinadores fantásticos.
meaning_2: Expresses frustration or sarcasm, perhaps indicating disappointment in the sponsors' contributions.
translation_2: Este año tuvimos unos patrocinadores fantásticos.

sentence: Flu cases are significantly down this year.
prosody_1: Flu cases are *significantly down* this year!
meaning_1: Expresses happiness and relief that fewer people are getting the flu.
translation_1: Los casos de gripe han caído considerablemente este año.
prosody_2: Flu cases are *significantly down* this year...
meaning_2: Conveys disapproval, perhaps suggesting skepticism about the data or remaining issues despite the decrease.
translation_2: Los casos de gripe han disminuido significativamente este año.

sentence: We achieved major milestones in disease control.
meaning_1: Conveys pride and happiness about significant successes in controlling disease.
translation_1: Logramos algunos hitos importantes en el control de enfermedades.
meaning_2: Conveys sarcasm or dissatisfaction, possibly implying that the milestones are insufficient or overhyped.
translation_2: Hemos logrado hitos importantes en el control de enfermedades.

sentence: Everyone is participating in the cleanup effort.
meaning_1: Indicates joy and enthusiasm about broad community involvement in the cleanup.
translation_1: Todos están participando en el esfuerzo de limpieza.
meaning_2: Conveys sarcasm or disbelief, suggesting not everyone might be genuinely participating.
translation_2: Todos están colaborando en el esfuerzo de limpieza.

sentence: We finally have the cure.
meaning_1: Conveys immense joy and relief at achieving a long-sought goal.
translation_1: Por fin tenemos la cura.
meaning_2: Implies skepticism, perhaps hinting that the cure might not be as effective or genuine as hoped.
translation_2: Finalmente tenemos la tan esperada cura.

sentence: The community turnout was surprising.
meaning_1: Expresses disappointment and irritation with the unexpected community turnout.
translation_1: La participación de la comunidad fue decepcionante.
meaning_2: Conveys excitement and pleasant surprise about the high community turnout.
translation_2: La participación de la comunidad fue increíble.

sentence: He's adapting well to his new family.
meaning_1: Expresses happiness and satisfaction with the dog's adjustment to his new home.
translation_1: Él se está adaptando bien a la nueva familia que tiene.
meaning_2: Conveys skepticism and disapproval about the quality of his adaptation.
translation_2: Él se está adaptando muy bien a su nueva familia.

sentence: Our city received the clean city award.
prosody_1: Our city received the clean city _award_!
meaning_1: Expresses joy and pride in the city's achievement of a clean city award.
translation_1: Nuestra ciudad recibió el cuestionable premio a la ciudad limpia.
meaning_2: Conveys skepticism and disdain, implying that the city did not deserve the award.
translation_2: Nuestra ciudad recibió el premio a la ciudad limpia.

sentence: They were heroes.
meaning_1: The speaker is proud and joyful, celebrating the heroism of these people.
translation_1: Ellos solían ser héroes.
meaning_2: The speaker is saddened by the passing of time or the loss of these heroic figures.
translation_2: Ellos eran héroes.

sentence: This is how you treat loyal customers.
prosody_1: This is how you *TREAT* loyal customers!
meaning_1: Communicates outrage and indignation at the perceived mistreatment.
translation_1: Esto es como tratas a los clientes leales.
meaning_2: Conveys disbelief and concern at being treated poorly despite loyalty.
translation_2: ¿Así es como tratas a los clientes leales?

sentence: This product isn't worth the price.
meaning_1: Emphasizes anger at feeling overcharged for a poor-quality product.
translation_1: Este producto no vale lo que cuesta.
meaning_2: Conveys surprise at the product's low quality relative to its cost.
translation_2: Este producto no vale el precio.

sentence: We really let them take over the game.
prosody_1: We really *LET* them take over the *GAME*!
meaning_1: Anger at the team for allowing the opponents to dominate.
translation_1: Realmente les dejamos tomar el control del juego.
prosody_2: We really let _them_ take over the game!?!
meaning_2: Surprised that the team failed to maintain control over the game.
translation_2: De verdad dejamos que ellos controlaran el juego.

sentence: He paid off the officials.
meaning_1: Indicates anger and frustration regarding the unethical behavior of bribing officials.
translation_1: Él sobornó a los funcionarios.
meaning_2: Expresses shock and disbelief upon discovering the bribery, indicating it was unforeseen.
translation_2: Él realmente sobornó a los funcionarios?

sentence: He took a bribe.
meaning_1: Expresses strong condemnation and anger towards the act of accepting a bribe.
translation_1: Él aceptó un soborno de una manera imperdonable.
meaning_2: Conveys shock and disbelief upon discovering that a bribe was accepted.

sentence: This isn't what we talked about.

prosody_1: You need to change your project topic.

translation_1: Necesitas cambiar el tema de tu proyecto.
meaning_2: Conveys surprise and perhaps dismay at the unexpected need to change the project topic.
translation_2: Necesitas cambiar el tema de tu proyecto, ¿en serio?

sentence: We lost the backup files.
meaning_1: Simply informs that the backup files are lost, with no strong emotional indication.
translation_1: Hemos perdido los archivos de respaldo.
meaning_2: Shows astonishment and concern that the backup files are unexpectedly lost.
translation_2: ¿Perdimos los archivos de respaldo?

sentence: We have to leave for the trip tomorrow.
prosody_1: We have to leave for the trip tomorrow.
meaning_1: Simply stating the new travel plan with no additional emotional context.
translation_1: Tenemos que irnos de viaje mañana.
prosody_2: We *have to* leave for the trip *tomorrow*!?!
meaning_2: Expresses shock at the sudden notice of the trip's departure.
translation_2: ¿Tenemos que irnos de viaje mañana?

sentence: We have to rebook our connecting flight.
prosody_1: We have to rebook our connecting flight.
meaning_1: Plainly indicating the need to rebook a flight.
translation_1: Tenemos que volver a reservar nuestro vuelo de conexión.
meaning_2: Surprise and possible frustration about the unexpected need to rebook.
translation_2: ¿Tenemos que volver a reservar nuestro vuelo de conexión?

sentence: You bought so many things.
meaning_1: A simple observation about a large quantity of purchases.
translation_1: Compraste tantas cosas.
meaning_2: Expresses surprise at the quantity of items someone has bought.
translation_2: Compraste muchísimas cosas.

sentence: The company is moving to a new location.
prosody_1: The company is moving to a new location.
meaning_1: States the fact that the company is relocating without any particular emotional tone.
translation_1: La empresa se está mudando a una nueva ubicación.
prosody_2: The *company* is *moving* to a new location?!
meaning_2: Shows surprise about the unexpected decision that the entire company is relocating.
translation_2: ¿La empresa se está mudando a una nueva ubicación?

sentence: The team will be restructured next month.
prosody_1: The team will be restructured next month.
meaning_1: Conveys the information that there will be organizational changes in the team without added emotion.
translation_1: El equipo será reestructurado el próximo mes.
meaning_2: Shows disbelief about the unexpected timing or nature of the upcoming team changes.
translation_2: ¿El equipo será reestructurado el próximo mes?

sentence: There's been a major change in the policy.
prosody_1: There's been a major change in the policy.
meaning_1: Provides the information about a significant policy alteration plainly.
translation_1: Ha habido un cambio importante en la política.
prosody_2: There's been a _major_ change in the *policy*?!
meaning_2: Conveys surprise at the unexpected and substantial policy modification.
translation_2: Ha habido un gran cambio en la política.

sentence: The project is being delayed by six months.
prosody_1: The project is being delayed by six months.
meaning_1: Informs about a delay in the project timeline without emotional coloring.
translation_1: El proyecto se está retrasando seis meses.
prosody_2: The *project* is being _delayed_ by six months?!
meaning_2: Conveys shock at the considerable extension in the project timeline.
translation_2: ¿El proyecto se está retrasando seis meses?

sentence: Jane couldn't make it.
meaning_1: Conveys sadness because Jane's absence is due to her passing.
translation_1: Jane no pudo venir.
meaning_2: Expresses astonishment that Jane won't be attending, implying unexpected circumstances.
translation_2: ¿No pudo venir Jane?

sentence: The police caught the culprit.
meaning_1: Implies sadness or disappointment perhaps at the state of affairs or deeper implications.
translation_1: La policía atrapó al culpable.
meaning_2: Expresses astonishment that the police actually managed to apprehend the culprit.
translation_2: ¿De verdad la policía atrapó al culpable?

sentence: Your request is being processed.
meaning_1: Reassuring the customer that their request is underway.
translation_1: Su solicitud se está tramitando.
meaning_2: Implying impatience, suggesting the customer should stop asking.
translation_2: Tu solicitud está siendo procesada.

sentence: I need your account number.
meaning_1: Politely asking the customer for their account number.
translation_1: Necesito por favor tu número de cuenta.
meaning_2: Impatiently demanding the account number, conveying exasperation.
translation_2: Dame tu número de cuenta ahora.

sentence: You will have to call back later.
prosody_1: You will have to call back _later_.
meaning_1: Nicely suggesting the customer call back at a later time.
translation_1: Tendrás que llamar más tarde.
prosody_2: You will have to call back *LATER*.
meaning_2: Forcing the customer to call back and implying it’s inconvenient now.
translation_2: Tienes que llamar más tarde.

sentence: I'm here to help you.
meaning_1: Warm assurance that you are ready to assist.
translation_1: Estoy aquí para ayudarte.
meaning_2: Implying the customer doesn't appreciate your assistance.
translation_2: Estoy aquí para ayudarte, ¿lo entiendes?

sentence: Please stay on the line.
meaning_1: Kindly asking the customer to not hang up.
translation_1: Por favor, mantente en la línea.
meaning_2: Demanding the customer not hang up, possibly impatiently.
translation_2: Por favor, quédate en la línea.

sentence: Can you provide more details?
meaning_1: Courteously asking for additional information.
translation_1: ¿Podrías proporcionar más detalles?
meaning_2: Implying the previous information was inadequate or unclear.
translation_2: ¿Acaso puedes proporcionar más detalles?

sentence: Can you send me that report?
meaning_1: A polite request to send a report.
translation_1: ¿Podrías enviarme ese informe?
meaning_2: Indicating impatience or frustration over not having received the report yet.
translation_2: ¿Puedes enviarme ese informe?

sentence: Can we talk?
meaning_1: A friendly request to have a conversation.
translation_1: Podemos hablar?
meaning_2: Suggests a serious or confrontational conversation is needed.
translation_2: Necesitamos hablar?

sentence: Is this your best work?
meaning_1: A polite question verifying effort.
translation_1: ¿Es este tu mejor esfuerzo?
meaning_2: Indicates strong dissatisfaction with the quality of work.
translation_2: ¿Esto es lo mejor que puedes hacer?

sentence: Is everything okay?
meaning_1: Expressing genuine concern.
translation_1: ¿Está todo bien?
meaning_2: Implying that things are clearly not okay, and expressing frustration.
translation_2: ¿De verdad todo está bien?

sentence: Can I have a moment of your time?
prosody_1: Can I have a _moment_ of your time?
meaning_1: Politely asking for someone's attention.
translation_1: ¿Podría tener un momento de tu tiempo?
prosody_2: Can I have a *MOMENT* of your time?
meaning_2: Indicates impatience or frustration in needing someone's attention.
translation_2: ¿Me puedes dar un momento de tu tiempo?

sentence: This needs to be done.
meaning_1: A gentle reminder about a task.
translation_1: Esto debe hacerse.
meaning_2: Indicating urgency or frustration over pending work.
translation_2: Esto tiene que hacerse.

sentence: When will you finish?
meaning_1: Politely inquiring about project completion time.
translation_1: ¿Cuándo terminarás?
meaning_2: Expressing impatience or pressure regarding the deadline.
translation_2: ¿Cuándo vas a terminar?

sentence: Please open your textbook.
meaning_1: A gentle request to open the textbook.
translation_1: Por favor, abre tu libro de texto.
meaning_2: A stern demand to open the textbook immediately.
translation_2: Por favor abre tu libro de texto.

sentence: Are you ready for the test?
meaning_1: A simple inquiry about test preparedness.
translation_1: ¿Estás listo para el examen?
meaning_2: A challenging or doubtful question about test preparedness.
translation_2: ¿Estás preparado para el examen?

sentence: Let's begin the lecture.
meaning_1: A friendly signal to start the lecture.
translation_1: Comencemos la conferencia.
meaning_2: An impatient signal to start the lecture.
translation_2: Ya comencemos la conferencia.

sentence: Please pay attention.
meaning_1: A calm request to listen.
translation_1: Por favor, presten atención.
meaning_2: A commanding tone demanding immediate focus.
translation_2: Por favor presten atención.

sentence: You need to try harder.
meaning_1: Encouraging someone to put in more effort.
translation_1: Te hace falta esforzarte más.
meaning_2: Expressing disappointment with the current effort level.
translation_2: Necesitas esforzarte más.

sentence: Take out your notes.
meaning_1: A polite request to take out notes.
translation_1: Saca tus apuntes, por favor.
meaning_2: An irritated command to take out notes immediately.
translation_2: Saca tus notas.

sentence: We need to talk after class.
meaning_1: A request for a private conversation.
translation_1: Necesitaría hablar contigo después de clase.
meaning_2: A stern indication that a serious discussion is necessary.
translation_2: Necesitamos hablar seriamente después de clase.

sentence: Please sit down.
meaning_1: A respectful request to take a seat.
translation_1: Por favor tome asiento.
meaning_2: A commanding order to sit down at once.
translation_2: Siéntese de una vez.

sentence: Please clean your room.
meaning_1: A gentle suggestion to tidy up their room.
translation_1: Por favor, podrías limpiar tu habitación.
meaning_2: An impatient demand to clean the room immediately.
translation_2: Por favor, limpia tu habitación.

sentence: It's time to go to bed.
meaning_1: A gentle reminder that it's bedtime.
translation_1: Ya es hora de ir a la cama.
meaning_2: A command asserting bedtime with irritation.
translation_2: Es hora de irte a la cama.

sentence: Can you please help me?
meaning_1: Politely asking for assistance.
translation_1: ¿Serías tan amable de ayudarme?
meaning_2: Expressing exasperation at lack of help.
translation_2: ¿Podrías ayudarme de una vez?

sentence: Can you set the table?
meaning_1: A pleasant request to help with setting the table.
translation_1: ¿Podrías poner la mesa?
meaning_2: An impatient directive to set the table.
translation_2: ¿Puedes poner la mesa ya?

sentence: Can you pick up your toys?
meaning_1: Nicely asking to put away the toys.
translation_1: ¿Podrías recoger tus juguetes?
meaning_2: Demanding the toys be picked up immediately.
translation_2: ¿Puedes recoger tus juguetes?

sentence: You need to finish your food.
meaning_1: A gentle encouragement to eat the meal.
translation_1: Necesitas terminar tu comida.
meaning_2: An order to eat up, expressing impatience.
translation_2: Necesitas acabar tu comida.

sentence: Can you stop doing that?
meaning_1: A calm request to stop an action.
translation_1: ¿Puedes dejar de hacer eso?
meaning_2: Showing irritation towards the action.
translation_2: ¿Puedes parar de una vez con eso?

sentence: Can you pass the salt?
meaning_1: A polite request to pass the salt.
translation_1: ¿Me podrías pasar la sal?
meaning_2: An impatient or irritated demand.
translation_2: ¿Pasas la sal?

sentence: Could you repeat that?
meaning_1: A polite request for repetition.
translation_1: ¿Podrías repetir eso, por favor?
meaning_2: An exasperated demand due to not hearing or understanding.
translation_2: ¿Podrías repetir eso?

sentence: Can you explain this?
meaning_1: Politely asking for clarification.
translation_1: ¿Podrías explicar esto?
meaning_2: Implying frustration or confusion, sounding irritated.
translation_2: ¿Puedes explicar esto?

sentence: Could you speak louder?
meaning_1: A gentle request to increase volume.
translation_1: ¿Podrías hablar un poco más alto?
meaning_2: Irritated demand for louder speaking, implying current volume is inadequate.
translation_2: ¿Podrías hablar más alto?

sentence: Can you clarify that point?
meaning_1: A polite request for further explanation.
translation_1: ¿Podrías aclarar ese punto?
meaning_2: A critical tone implying the speaker is being unclear.
translation_2: ¿Acaso puedes aclarar ese punto?

sentence: Your time is almost up.
meaning_1: A gentle reminder regarding the time limit.
translation_1: Su tiempo casi se termina.
meaning_2: A sharp warning to conclude quickly.
translation_2: Se te está acabando el tiempo.

sentence: That was an interesting point.
meaning_1: A genuine compliment about a point made.
translation_1: Eso fue un punto interesante.
meaning_2: A sarcastic comment implying the point was not interesting.
translation_2: Eso fue un punto curioso.

sentence: Could you repeat the question?
meaning_1: A polite request for repetition for clarity.
translation_1: ¿Podrías repetir la pregunta por favor?
meaning_2: An impatient request indicating frustration.
translation_2: ¿Podrías volver a repetir la pregunta?

sentence: Try to engage with the audience.
meaning_1: A friendly suggestion for better interaction.
translation_1: Intenta conectar con el público.
meaning_2: A critical tone suggesting current interaction is poor.
translation_2: Intenta comprometerte con el público.

sentence: Remember to speak slowly.
meaning_1: A gentle reminder to slow down speech.
translation_1: Recuerda hablar despacio.
meaning_2: An annoyed emphasis implying the speaker is too fast.
translation_2: Recuerda bien hablar despacio.

sentence: What is your main argument?
meaning_1: A simple inquiry about the primary point.
translation_1: ¿Cuál es tu principal argumento?
meaning_2: A frustrated question implying the argument is unclear.
translation_2: ¿Cuál es tu argumento principal?

sentence: Please present your evidence.
meaning_1: A polite request to submit evidence.
translation_1: Tenga la bondad de presentar sus pruebas.
meaning_2: A demand with an impatient tone, possibly implying urgency or frustration.
translation_2: Presente sus pruebas.

sentence: Are you ready to proceed?
meaning_1: A polite inquiry if all parties are prepared to continue.
translation_1: ¿Estás listo para proceder?
meaning_2: An impatient or frustrated demand about readiness.
translation_2: ¿Vas a estar listo de una vez para seguir?

sentence: Would you like to call your next witness?
prosody_1: Would you like to _call_ your _next witness_?
meaning_1: Politely asking if the lawyer wants to call the next witness.
translation_1: ¿Le gustaría llamar a su próximo testigo?
prosody_2: Would you like to *CALL* your *NEXT WITNESS*?
meaning_2: Impatiently urging the lawyer to proceed with calling their next witness.
translation_2: ¿Quiere llamar a su próximo testigo?

sentence: Can you explain your actions?
meaning_1: A polite request for an explanation of actions.
translation_1: ¿Podrías explicar tus acciones?
meaning_2: A demand for an explanation, implying impatience or frustration.
translation_2: ¿Puedes explicar tus acciones?

sentence: Do you have any objections?
meaning_1: A polite inquiry about any objections.
translation_1: ¿Tienes alguna objeción?
meaning_2: An impatient or frustrated tone asking for objections.
translation_2: ¿Acaso tienes alguna objeción?

sentence: Will you take the stand?
meaning_1: A polite request asking a witness if they are ready to testify.
translation_1: ¿Podrías testificar?
meaning_2: A rude or impatient demand for the witness to testify.
translation_2: ¿Vas a testificar de una vez?

sentence: Do you have anything to add?
meaning_1: A polite question asking if there is more information to share.
translation_1: ¿Tienes algo más que aportar?
meaning_2: An impatient or sarcastic inquiry asking for additional information.
translation_2: ¿Tienes algo que añadir?

sentence: Can I have a moment?
meaning_1: A polite request for a brief pause or moment.
translation_1: ¿Podría tener un momento?
meaning_2: An exasperated or frustrated request for a pause, implying impatience.
translation_2: ¿Me das un momento?

sentence: Do you have any further questions?
meaning_1: A polite inquiry about any additional questions.
translation_1: ¿Tienes alguna otra duda?
meaning_2: An impatient or frustrated inquiry about additional questions.
translation_2: ¿Tienes más preguntas o no?

sentence: Can you produce the documents?
meaning_1: A polite request for document submission.
translation_1: ¿Podrías producir los documentos?
meaning_2: A demand for document submission, implying impatience or frustration.
translation_2: ¿Eres capaz de producir los documentos?

sentence: Will you follow court etiquette?
meaning_1: A polite reminder or request to adhere to court etiquette.
translation_1: ¿Podrías seguir las normas del tribunal?
meaning_2: An impatient or sarcastic demand to adhere to court etiquette.
translation_2: ¿Vas a seguir de una vez las normas del tribunal?

sentence: Can you please sit down?
meaning_1: Politely asking the patient to sit down.
translation_1: ¿Podrías sentarte, por favor?
meaning_2: Impatiently demanding the patient to sit down.
translation_2: ¿Puedes sentarte de una vez?

sentence: I need to take your blood pressure.
prosody_1: I _need_ to take your blood pressure.
meaning_1: Requesting to take the patient's blood pressure.
translation_1: Necesito tomarle la presión arterial.
prosody_2: I *NEED* to take your blood pressure.
meaning_2: Strictly insisting on taking the patient's blood pressure, expressing irritation.
translation_2: Necesito tomar tu presión arterial ahora mismo.

sentence: Can you describe your symptoms?
meaning_1: Politely asking for a description of symptoms.
translation_1: ¿Podrías describir tus síntomas?
meaning_2: Impatiently insisting on getting the symptoms described.
translation_2: ¿Vas a describir tus síntomas?

sentence: This will only take a minute.
meaning_1: Reassuring the patient that the procedure will be quick.
translation_1: Esto solo tomará un minuto.
meaning_2: Impatiently informing the patient that it won't take long, implying they should not fuss.
translation_2: Esto solo tomará un minuto, no te pongas así.

sentence: I need to draw some blood.
meaning_1: Explaining the necessity of drawing blood.
translation_1: Necesito sacar un poco de sangre.
meaning_2: Firmly stating the need to draw blood, possibly impatiently.
translation_2: Tengo que sacar sangre ahora mismo.

sentence: Could you remove your shirt?
meaning_1: Politely asking the patient to remove their shirt for examination.
translation_1: ¿Podría quitarse la camisa?
meaning_2: Abruptly instructing the patient to take off their shirt, showing impatience.
translation_2: Quítese la camisa.

sentence: It's important that you relax.
meaning_1: Encouraging the patient to relax for their well-being.
translation_1: Es importante que te relajes.
meaning_2: Commanding the patient to relax, indicating stress or impatience.
translation_2: Es crucial que te relajes.

sentence: Have you completed your forms?
meaning_1: Politely asking if the forms are complete.
translation_1: ¿Has completado tus formularios?
meaning_2: Impatiently inquiring whether the forms are done.
translation_2: ¿Terminaste tus formularios?

sentence: Please put on the gown.
meaning_1: Politely instructing to wear the gown.
translation_1: Por favor, póngase la bata.
meaning_2: Abruptly ordering the patient to wear the gown, showing impatience.
translation_2: Póngase la bata.

sentence: Do you have a reservation?
meaning_1: A simple inquiry about a reservation.
translation_1: ¿Tiene usted una reserva?
meaning_2: Questioning if someone is authorized or implying they shouldn't be there without a reservation.
translation_2: ¿Tienes una reserva o qué?

sentence: How can I help you?
meaning_1: Offering assistance warmly.
translation_1: ¿Cómo puedo ayudarte?
meaning_2: Implying frustration or exasperation.
translation_2: ¿Qué quieres que haga?

sentence: Is there anything else you need?
meaning_1: Kindly ensuring all needs are met.
translation_1: ¿Hay algo más que necesites?
meaning_2: Suggesting impatience or annoyance.
translation_2: ¿Cómo que necesitas algo más?

sentence: I'll be with you shortly.
meaning_1: Conveying an understanding of slight delay.
translation_1: Ya estaré contigo en un momento.
meaning_2: Implying annoyance or frustration about being interrupted.
translation_2: Estaré contigo en breve.

sentence: Enjoy your meal.
meaning_1: Wishing someone a pleasant meal.
translation_1: Que disfrutes de tu comida.
meaning_2: Implying sarcasm or insincerity.
translation_2: Disfruta tu comida, si puedes.

sentence: Is your room comfortable?
meaning_1: Genuinely inquiring about the comfort of the room.
translation_1: ¿Es cómoda tu habitación?
meaning_2: Suggesting disbelief or impatience regarding complaints.
translation_2: ¿De verdad es cómoda tu habitación?

sentence: Can I clear your plate?
meaning_1: Asking permission to clear the plate.
translation_1: ¿Puedo llevarme tu plato?
meaning_2: Implying impatience or that the plate should have been cleared already.
translation_2: ¿Puedo llevarme de una vez el plato?

sentence: Would you like anything from the bar?
meaning_1: Offering drinks from the bar.
translation_1: ¿Te gustaría algo del bar?
meaning_2: Implying impatience for the order or frustration.
translation_2: ¿Quieres algo del bar?

sentence: Do you have a loyalty card?
meaning_1: A courteous inquiry about a loyalty card.
translation_1: ¿Tiene usted una tarjeta de fidelidad?
meaning_2: An impatient question about whether the customer has a loyalty card.
translation_2: ¿Tienes tarjeta de fidelidad o no?

sentence: Would you like a bag?
meaning_1: Politely asking if a bag is desired.
translation_1: ¿Te gustaría una bolsa?
meaning_2: Snappily suggesting the need for a bag.
translation_2: ¿Quieres una bolsa?

sentence: Your total is $15.99.
meaning_1: Stating the total patiently.
translation_1: Su total es $15.99.
meaning_2: Emphasizing impatience over the total.
translation_2: Tu total es $15.99.

sentence: Can you sit down?
meaning_1: A polite request for someone to take a seat.
translation_1: ¿Podrías sentarte?
meaning_2: A rude demand for someone to sit immediately.
translation_2: ¿Te puedes sentar ya?

sentence: Can you move your bag?
meaning_1: A polite request to move the bag to make space.
translation_1: ¿Podrías mover tu bolso, por favor?
meaning_2: Annoyance at someone for occupying space with their bag.

sentence: Can I sit here?
meaning_1: Polite request to take a seat.
translation_1: ¿Puedo sentarme aquí?

translation_2: ¿Yo puedo sentarme aquí?

sentence: Can you hold this for a moment?
prosody_1: Can you _hold this_ for a moment?
meaning_1: Politely asking someone to hold an item momentarily.
translation_1: ¿Podrías sostener esto por un momento?
meaning_2: Annoyed or demanding request to hold an item.
translation_2: ¿Puedes sostener esto por un momento?

sentence: Can you let me pass?
meaning_1: Polite request to make way.
translation_1: ¿Me podrías dejar pasar?
meaning_2: Rude demand to move out of the way.

sentence: Could you lower your voice?
meaning_1: Politely asking someone to speak more quietly.

meaning_2: Irritated request for someone to be quiet.
translation_2: ¿Podrías bajar la voz?

sentence: Are you getting off here?
meaning_1: Politely verifying if someone is getting off at this stop.

meaning_2: Impatiently checking if someone should be leaving.

sentence: Do you mind if I sit here?
meaning_1: Politely asking if it's okay to take the seat.

sentence: Can you help me organize the event?
prosody_1: Can you _help_ me organize the event?
meaning_1: A polite request for assistance in organizing the event.
translation_1: ¿Podrías ayudarme a organizar el evento?
prosody_2: Can you *HELP* me organize the event?
meaning_2: An urgent or frustrated plea for help with organizing the event.
translation_2: ¿Puedes ayudarme a organizar el evento?

sentence: When can we start the clean-up drive?
prosody_1: When can we _start_ the clean-up drive?
meaning_1: Inquiring politely about the commencement of the clean-up drive.
translation_1: ¿Cuándo podemos comenzar la campaña de limpieza?
prosody_2: When can we *START* the clean-up drive?
meaning_2: Expressing impatience regarding the start of the clean-up drive.

sentence: Can we discuss the budget now?
meaning_1: A polite suggestion to discuss the budget.

meaning_2: Impatiently or firmly requesting to discuss the budget.
translation_2: ¿Podemos discutir el presupuesto ahora?

sentence: Do you know the agenda for tomorrow?
prosody_1: Do you _know_ the agenda for tomorrow?
meaning_1: A casual inquiry about the agenda for tomorrow.
translation_1: ¿Conoces la agenda para mañana?
prosody_2: Do you *KNOW* the agenda for tomorrow?
meaning_2: Questioning someone's preparedness with an annoyed tone.

sentence: Is this venue suitable for the workshop?
prosody_1: Is this _venue_ suitable for the workshop?
meaning_1: Politely asking about the suitability of the venue.
translation_1: ¿Es este lugar adecuado para el taller?
prosody_2: Is this *venue* suitable for the workshop?
meaning_2: Casting doubt or expressing dissatisfaction with the venue choice.

sentence: Can you explain your position?
meaning_1: A genuine request for clarification.
translation_1: ¿Puedes explicar tu posición?
meaning_2: An exasperated demand for someone to justify themselves.
translation_2: ¿Acaso puedes justificar tu postura?

sentence: Can you back that up?
meaning_1: Requesting evidence in a courteous manner.
translation_1: ¿Podrías respaldar eso?
meaning_2: Challenging someone aggressively for proof.
translation_2: ¿Puedes respaldar eso?

sentence: Do you have any experience in this field?
prosody_1: Do you _have_ any experience in this _field_?
meaning_1: Politely inquiring about someone's qualifications.
translation_1: ¿Tienes alguna experiencia en este campo?
prosody_2: Do you *HAVE* any experience in this *FIELD*?
meaning_2: Doubting someone's expertise or competence.
